overview: This two-part subject provides students with the opportunity to learn the essential skills needed to undertake research. In addition, students will gain first-hand experience in experimental design, and in data collection, analysis, and presentation. Students will undertake a literature review, a research report and an oral presentation.
This subject must be taken in conjunction with DENT90110 Research Project B in consecutive years.
ilo: Conduct research in biomedical, dental and health sciences.
Prepare and give oral and written presentation of the results.
Assimilate and critically evaluate existing knowledge within a scientific paradigm.
generic_skills: Articulating the breadth of knowledge gained in a particular discipline;
Critical appraisal of draft documents; developing the ability to exercise critical judgement;

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.hurdle: Students must meet satisfactory requirements. Re-assessment will be permitted with a fail of 40-49. Maximum grade on re-assessment is 50.
assessment.timing: Towards the end of the Research Project A
